page.title: 06REPLANTING IN S.ELKINGTON
page.content: Approximately 200 acres of woodland, 99% deciduous.Replanting with larch, spruce, beech, ash and oak taking place at a rate of 4-5 acres annually where dead elms taken out or trees felled for timber.At Thorpe Hall re- planting with sycamore and horse chestnut.On the Elkington Estate,two men work full time 8 months of the year, looking after the woodland, which provides shelter for cattle,game cover,and encourages wild life. Hedges are trimmed annually, some are layered.Most were planted late 18th and early 19th century,_a few medieval Planting with hawthorn has taken place during the last 4 yrs.,as an amenity to encourage wild life and break up the skyline,one near Acthorpe House, another where quarry pit filled in. Also replanting where hedges scrubbed up 15yrs. ago.
